fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.types

Interface IArrayData

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IData<IArrayType>, IListStructure

    public interface IArrayData
extends IData<IArrayType>, IListStructure
    Provides typed access to an array dataset for a cell.

    Create, update, and delete operations performed using items in this list structure will only be committed when the container is stored. The store operation should be an atomic transaction.

    Authentication and authorization: all operations are performed using the ITicket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure.

    Thread-safety: implementations of this interface are not required to be safe for concurrent access. Therefore, processing should generally not be shared between multiple threads.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Detail

      • fetchItems

        List<IArrayItem> fetchItems()
                     throws ListFetchException
        Retrieves all items in the list for this array data set, with default sorting options and no filter or range criteria. This is the default fetch operation when the array data is fetched without deferral.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure.

        Returns:
        the list of array items, possibly empty, never null.
        Throws:
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ListFetchException - if the fetch fails.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetchCount(), fetchItems(IFilter, ISort, IRange, EnumSet), fetchItems(IFilter, ISort, IRange, Set)

      • fetchItems

        List<IArrayItem> fetchItems(IFilter filter,
                            ISort sort,
                            IRange range,
                            EnumSet<Defer> defer)
                     throws ListFetchException
        Fetches a list of item references in the specified range matching the specified filter with the specifed sorting rules, and optionally deferring retrievable of certain categories of data.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure.

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter for items to select, or null.
        sort - the sorting rules for items to select, or null.
        range - the range of items to select, or null (if null, all items are fetched, which may lead to performance issues). The contents of the range will also depend on any defined filter or sort.
        defer - the categories of data to fetch lazily (on demand). If null, is equivalent to EnumSet.allOf(Defer.class).
        Returns:
        the list. Never returns null, may return an empty list.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the filter, sort or range do not apply to this source.
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ListFetchException - if the fetch fails.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetchItems(IFilter, ISort, IRange, EnumSet), fetchItems(IFilter, ISort, IRange, Set)

      • fetchItems

        List<IArrayItem> fetchItems(IFilter filter,
                            ISort sort,
                            IRange range,
                            Set<ICell> fetchable)
                     throws ListFetchException
        Fetches a list of item references in the specified range matching the specified filter with the specifed sorting rules, initially retrieving only data for the specified set of cells.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure.

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter for items to select, or null.
        sort - the sorting rules for items to select, or null.
        range - the range of items to select, or null (if null, all items are fetched, which may lead to performance issues). The contents of the range will also depend on any defined filter or sort.
        fetchable - the fetchable data cells. All other data is fetched lazily (on demand). It is an error for this set to be null or empty.
        Returns:
        the list. Never returns null, may return an empty list.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the filter, sort or range do not apply to this source.
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ListFetchException - if the fetch fails.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetchItems(IFilter, ISort, IRange, EnumSet), fetchItems(IFilter, ISort, IRange, Set)

      • fetchCount

        long fetchCount()
         throws FetchException
        Retrieves the number items in the list for this array data set, without filter or range criteria. This is the default count operation when the array data is fetched without deferral. Does not require fetching the actual data.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure.

        Returns:
        the number of array items.
        Throws:
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        FetchException - if the fetch fails.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetchItems(), fetchCount(IFilter)

      • fetchCount

        long fetchCount(IFilter filter)
         throws FetchException
        Fetches the number of records that can be returned for this array data set, with the specified filter. Should not fetch the actual data.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure.

        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to use. May be null.
        Returns:
        the number of matching records.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the filter does not apply to this source.
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        FetchException - if the fetch fails.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        fetchCount()

      • createItem

        IArrayItem createItem()
        Creates a new (empty and unsaved) item that can be stored by the record source.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure. The operation does not take effect until the parent data structure is stored, however it will appear to have taken effect when using the different methods of the current object.

        Returns:
        the new (empty and unsaved) record.
        Throws:
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        Since:
        1.0

      • delete

        int delete(IArrayItem... items)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Deletes the specified items.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure. The operation does not take effect until the parent data structure is stored, however it will appear to have taken effect when using the different methods of the current object.

        Parameters:
        items - items (belonging to this source) to delete.
        Returns:
        the number of items deleted, if known and permanent. Note: "eventually consistent" non-atomic sources may choose not report this, and some other source types may just simply be unaware. When unknown, this therefore returns -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the items do not belong to this source (or if any are null).
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when the operation failed during processing.
        Since:
        1.0

      • delete

        int delete(IKey... keys)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Deletes the items matching the specified keys.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure. The operation does not take effect until the parent data structure is stored, however it will appear to have taken effect when using the different methods of the current object.

        Parameters:
        keys - keys of items (belonging to this source) to delete.
        Returns:
        the number of items deleted, if known and permanent. Note: "eventually consistent" non-atomic sources may choose not report this, and some other source types may just simply be unaware. When unknown, this therefore returns -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the keys do not apply to this source (or if any are null).
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when the operation failed during processing.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        delete(ILogicFilter)

      • delete

        int delete(ILogicFilter filter)
    throws ItemStoreException
        Deletes the items matching the specified logic filter.

        This operation implies reuse of the ticket used to fetch the data structure containing this array structure. The operation does not take effect until the parent data structure is stored, however it will appear to have taken effect when using the different methods of the current object.

        Parameters:
        filter - boolean filter defining criteria to delete a volume of items in a single operation.
        Returns:
        the number of items deleted, if known and permanent. Note: "eventually consistent" non-atomic sources may choose not report this, and some other source types may just simply be unaware. When unknown, this therefore returns -1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the filter does not apply to this source.
        AuthzException - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
        ItemStoreException - when the operation failed during processing.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        delete(IKey...), delete(IArrayItem...)
